The real exchange rate vis-ÃÂ -vis the US dollar, RER(A/D), is similarly defined, RER(A/D) = (A/D)*(CPIU)/(CPIA), where CPIU is the CPI of the United States. In Figures 1-7, the real exchange rates, RER(A/Y) and RER(A/D) are plotted against the export volume, in bars, for each of NIEs (except Hong Kong) and four ASEAN countries, with the quarterly frequency, from 1981:1 to 1997:2. The levels of the real exchange rates are measured with normalization of the last observation equals one. The export volume is measured as the changes over the preceding four quarters.
